combined_text: Hunza Serena Inn Restaurant Upscale Dining An upscale option offering international and local dishes in a beautiful, traditional setting. Everything about Hunza Serena feels perfect  except the service. Having stayed at many Serena properties across Pakistan, I came in with high expectations. During my stay at Gilgit Serena last year, the staff treated us like royalty  anticipating our needs before we even voiced them. Hunza, unfortunately, fell short of that standard. Hotel & Location: The property itself is beautifully designed, perfectly located, and surrounded by breathtaking views. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and recently renovated, offering all the amenities one would expect from Serena. Rooms and Service: The most crazy thing was the lights. The bed side table lamps would not get turned off from any switch, we had to pull out the cable from under the table. Other light switches were also as if out of Alice in Wonderland, you would never be able to predict which switch elicited what reaction in the lights! Despite the lovely rooms, housekeeping was inconsistent. Used glasses and empty water bottles were removed but never replaced, and small details like this added up over the stay. Dining: The breakfast buffet was excellent  diverse, fresh, and satisfying. Food in the restaurants and room service menu were also good. However, the dining system was unnecessarily rigid and service was again below par. You could order Pizza and snacks at one restaurant on one side of the hotel, and other dishes in the other restaurant at the other end. Asking them to bring pizza to the other restaurant, or even taking it away to the other was not accepted. We had to sit in one restaurant while my daughter had her pizza, then move to the other for my food. Health Club & Pool: The facilities were impressive: separate ladies locker room with sauna, steam room, and jacuzzi; a standard gym; 2 outdoor heated pools (1 for kids) with mountain views. That said, there was no staff support, which felt both inconvenient and unsafe. No one was available in the ladies locker room to provide towels or locker keys, and the jacuzzi was under maintenance - staff more concerned about you getting out of their way than to help you. The sauna and steam room could not be turned on also because no-one was there (or willing) to do it. There was no staff not even a lifeguard at the pool, which is very concerning for guest safety. Spa Experience: I booked myself a 90-minute massage and arrived at the counter just a few minutes late, although I was in the spa. They asked me to fill a form, in which, among other things, I wrote that I wanted a medium massage. I was taken to the massage room 15 minutes after the start of my appointment. The masseuse washed my feet first and started the massage 20 minutes after the start time. The massage was nothing to write home about. When I asked her to put more pressure, she told me I had asked for a medium pressure, not a firm one. However, she did not read the part where I wrote I did not want my head to be massaged and proceeded to do it. She ended the massage bang on time, even though it had started 20 minutes late. I did not have the time on me, but I checked when I came to the locker room. So I got a 70-minute massage instead of 90. And the jacuzzi in the female locker room was not working, they told me I could use the jacuzzi in the male section, but I would be charged 10,000 rupees for half an hour. Overall: Hunza Serena has immense potential  stunning setting, well-designed facilities, and the Serena brand promise. But the service quality needs serious improvement to match the standards of other Serena properties. I truly hope the management will take steps to bring Hunzas hospitality up to the level that makes Serena so special elsewhere in Pakistan. An amazing hotel with beautiful views and great staff. We have been here a few days now and I highly recommend staying at this hotel with its close proximity to the bazaar and its gorgeous setting. We were well looked after and the staff can not be faulted in any way for their hospitality and efforts to ensure you have a truly amazing experience. A special mention for Duty Manager Farah who was exceptional and a truly gifted member of staff who was well informed on what a guest would expect and how to accommodate their requirements and expectations. I will be coming back and will stay here again. Excellent hotel with breathtaking views. Rooms were fantastic and quite big. Breakfast had a good selection of international and local options, the service froms taff in the breakfast hall was great. Staff are always helpful and things are done pretty instantly here. The key card stopped working pretty much everyday so had to get it resooved at reception each morning. Overall fantastic hotel - really enjoyed the stay here

combined_text: Babusar Top Chai Point Tea & Snacks Small shacks at the highest point of the pass serving hot tea and simple snacks to travelers. Babusar Top  A Piece of Heaven on Earth Visiting Babusar Top is like stepping into a dream. Nestled high in the mountains at over 13,000 feet, this breathtaking spot offers panoramic views that are beyond words  snow-capped peaks, lush green valleys, and clouds so close you feel like you can touch them. The journey to the top is equally mesmerizing, with winding roads, cascading waterfalls, and scenic landscapes at every turn. The cool breeze, peaceful silence, and majestic beauty make it a perfect escape from the hustle of city life. Whether youre a nature lover, photographer, or simply someone in search of peace, Babusar Top is a must-visit. Truly one of Pakistans most beautiful treasures.  What an incredible place! I visited with my family on June 25th. Just imagine one day you're enduring Karachi's scorching heat, and within two days, you're wrapped in a jacket, breathing in the fresh air, and soaking in breathtaking mountain views. It's an unforgettable experience you'll cherish forever. Not easy to reach, must have a car with proper tuned and powerful engine. 13700ft high is where you will feel breathing pressure. Amazing sceneries. Addiction to go beyond and more.

combined_text: Rama Meadow Tea Tent Tea Stall Basic tents in the meadow serving tea and instant noodles to trekkers and day visitors. Astore lies Rama Meadows, a stunning expanse of pastureland nestled in the mountains. As you arrive, youll first encounter a wide plateau where horses and cows graze freely against a dramatic alpine backdrop. From here, a moderate 1 hour and 15 minute hike leads you to the beautiful Rama Lake. The trail crosses several small glaciers and offers breathtaking views along the way. This excursion takes a full day and requires at least a basic level of fitness to complete on foot. Alternatively, horses are available for those who prefer not to hike. Rama Meadow is a stunning green field located near Astore in Gilgit-Baltistan. Surrounded by thick forests and snow-capped mountains, it offers peaceful scenery and fresh air. Its a perfect place for camping, relaxing, and preparing for a trek to the famous Nanga Parbat base camp. In summer, the lush green grass and colorful flowers make Rama Meadow look like a paradise. Beautiful,vast and stunning meadows. Lush green. Wild horses, rest houses, polo ground. Snowy mountains, glaciers, falling rocks, rustling trees. All in one package. Chongra peak also visible from here. Track to Rama lake starts from here.

Naran Bazar is the bustling commercial heart of Naran Valley, located in the scenic Kaghan region of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Surrounded by snow-capped peaks and lush greenery, the bazar serves as a central hub for tourists heading to destinations like Saif-ul-Malook, Babusar Top, and Lalazar. During the summer season, Naran Bazar becomes lively and colorful, filled with local vendors, tourists, and the aroma of traditional foods. The market offers a wide variety of items, including handicrafts, dry fruits, woolen shawls, gemstones, and souvenirs that reflect the local culture. Visitors often enjoy shopping for hand-carved wooden pieces, traditional caps, and locally made honey. The bazar also features numerous restaurants, tea stalls, and dhabas serving desi food, trout fish, and hot chapli kebabs. Despite its charm, the area can become overcrowded during peak seasons, and prices may rise due to high tourist demand. Still, Naran Bazar remains an essential stop for travelers, not just for shopping but also to experience the local lifestyle and hospitality. Whether you're looking for supplies before a trek or just enjoying a stroll in the cool mountain air, Naran Bazar offers a memorable and vibrant experience. Naran Bazar is on the top of mountain. Looking nice and beautiful. Naran Bazar shows us the beauty of nature. Horse riding is available here.

Hussaini Chowk (or intersection) is the main crossing of Shigar town- now a district HQ of the district that goes by the same name. It is located less than an hour from Skardu on the main road to Askole that used to be the last jeep-head and from where the Baltoro- K-2 Base Camp trek started. The Chowk is almost next to a beautiful mountain stream that comes down from the hills, crosses the town and empties into the Shigar River which itself joins the Indus at Skardu. About a kilometer from the Chowk is the 4-star Shigar Serena hotel that has been set up in the former residence of Shigar's ruling family, the Shigar Fort. It is one of the main bazaars of the Skardu city. All types of shops and commercial establishments such as hotels and restaurants are here in no particular order. Parking is a challenge. combined_text: Khaplu Fort Cafe Historic Cafe A cafe within the restored Khaplu Fort offering tea and snacks with a view of the mountains. Khaplu Fort, also known as Yabgo Khar, is one of Pakistans most breathtaking heritage gems, offering an extraordinary blend of royal history, cultural richness, and serene natural beauty. Built in the mid-19th century by the royal family of Khaplu, the fort served as the residence of the Raja of Khaplu and stands as a striking example of Tibetan, Kashmiri, Ladakhi, and Balti architectural influences. Nestled in the heart of the Ghanche District in Baltistan, surrounded by the towering Karakoram mountains and flowing glacial rivers, the fort has been beautifully restored by the Aga Khan Cultural Services and is now operated as a heritage boutique hotel by Serena Hotels. Walking through its intricately carved wooden balconies, traditional courtyards, and ancient stone walls feels like stepping back in time. The rooms are a harmonious mix of traditional Balti craftsmanship and modern comfort, providing guests with a royal yet cozy experience. The onsite restaurant serves both local and continental cuisine, with fresh organic ingredients and specialties like Balti meat curry and apricot desserts. The staff is courteous, knowledgeable, and passionate about sharing the history and culture of the region, offering guided tours of the fort, nearby mosques, and the charming Khaplu village. With its peaceful ambiance, rich heritage, and majestic mountain views, Khaplu Fort is more than a place to stayits a timeless journey into the royal past of Baltistan, making it a must-visit for travelers seeking authenticity, beauty, and tranquility in Pakistan's northern paradise. Babusar Top  A Piece of Heaven on Earth Visiting Babusar Top is like stepping into a dream. Nestled high in the mountains at over 13,000 feet, this breathtaking spot offers panoramic views that are beyond words  snow-capped peaks, lush green valleys, and clouds so close you feel like you can touch them. The journey to the top is equally mesmerizing, with winding roads, cascading waterfalls, and scenic landscapes at every turn. The cool breeze, peaceful silence, and majestic beauty make it a perfect escape from the hustle of city life. Whether youre a nature lover, photographer, or simply someone in search of peace, Babusar Top is a must-visit. Truly one of Pakistans most beautiful treasures.  What an incredible place! I visited with my family on June 25th. Just imagine one day you're enduring Karachi's scorching heat, and within two days, you're wrapped in a jacket, breathing in the fresh air, and soaking in breathtaking mountain views. It's an unforgettable experience you'll cherish forever. Not easy to reach, must have a car with proper tuned and powerful engine. 13700ft high is where you will feel breathing pressure. Amazing sceneries. Addiction to go beyond and more.

combined_text: Deosai Plains Shepherd's Tea Nomadic Tea Experience Sometimes, shepherds in the plains offer visitors a cup of salt tea, a unique nomadic experience. Deosai Plains, located in Gilgit-Baltistan, are among the highest plateaus in the world, often called the Land of Giants. Spanning lush green fields, snowcapped peaks, and wildflower meadows, the plains offer breathtaking views and a serene atmosphere. Visitors often spot wildlife like Himalayan brown bears and golden marmots. Accessible mainly during summer, Deosai is ideal for camping, photography, and nature lovers seeking peace and raw beauty. Its untouched charm makes it one of Pakistans most unique natural wonders. Heaven on Earth.. I been traveling Northern Areas of Pakistan since long, but this is the Jewel in Crown.. Amazing Scenery, breath taking views, cold streams, Lovely flowers, and chirping birds.. Nature has been kind to it.. It's sad to find Tourists littering the place. Me and My friend collected 2 bags full and deposited them at bins erected by local authorities.. Also plz don't put Loud Music into here, sound pollution is a hazard, and quite a few foreign tourists were complaining about it.. We rented a tent by a stream, its affordable, but sanitary conditions are appalling.. The quilts and pillows had mould and bugs.. Food served is NOT good for Health, You had to tell them thrice, what you wanted. Local people are polite and smiling all the time, Tourists should respect their culture and customs.. If you are with family, My humble advice is that in present sanitary conditions don't stay for Night, Skardu is nearby on 3 hours drive, rest there .. A must visit place for hikers and nature lovers ..  The Deosai Plains, also known as the Deosai National Park, are located in northern Pakistan, primarily in the Skardu District of Gilgit-Baltistan. They are one of the highest plateaus in the world, situated at an average altitude of about 4,114 meters (13,497 feet) above sea level. This breathtaking expanse of natural beauty spans approximately 3,000 square kilometers (1,158 square miles) and is often referred to as the "Land of Giants." Key Features 1. Stunning Landscape: The plains are known for their wide-open spaces, rolling hills, and lush green meadows during the summer months. In the spring, the area is covered with a vibrant blanket of wildflowers, creating a stunning contrast against the snow-capped mountains surrounding it. 2. Flora and Fauna: Deosai is home to unique wildlife, including the Himalayan brown bear, which is an endangered species. Other animals include red foxes, golden marmots, ibex, and snow leopards. The park also hosts a variety of migratory birds and butterflies. 3. Sheosar Lake: The park features the breathtaking Sheosar Lake, one of the highest lakes in the world. The name "Sheosar" means "Blind Lake" in the local language. The lake is renowned for its crystal-clear waters and mesmerizing reflections of the surrounding peaks. 4. Climate: The area experiences extreme weather, with harsh winters and a relatively short summer. During winter, the plains are covered in heavy snow, making them inaccessible for months. 5. Cultural and Historical Significance: Deosai has cultural importance to the local communities and is mentioned in many folklore and legends. 6. Tourism: It is a popular destination for adventurers, photographers, and nature lovers. Activities such as camping, trekking, and stargazing are common, especially during the summer season. Accessibility The Deosai Plains can be accessed via Skardu or Astore. The roads to the park are rugged and challenging, often requiring off-road vehicles. The best time to visit is from June to September when the snow has melted, and the area is accessible. The Deosai Plains are a testament to Pakistan's diverse natural beauty and a must-visit destination for those seeking serenity and adventure in the wilderness.

"Astore Valley: Breathtaking scenery, rich history, and warm hospitality. A hidden gem in Gilgit-Baltistan, perfect for trekking, camping, and nature lovers." A journey you will never forget. Astore Valley is a stunning and peaceful destination in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. Surrounded by snow-covered mountains and green meadows, it's perfect for nature lovers and trekkers. The valley offers fresh air, clean water, and beautiful views all around. Places like Rama Lake and Deosai Plains are nearby and add more beauty to the area. Roads can be rough, but the experience is worth it. Astore Valley is a breathtakingly beautiful destination in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan, known for its stunning scenery, diverse wildlife, and adventure activities. Here's what you can expect: Scenic Beauty The valley offers picturesque views of lush green meadows, towering mountains, and crystal-clear streams. The scenery is particularly breathtaking during the summer months when wildflowers bloom in vibrant colors. Places to Visit - *Rama Lake*: A popular spot with stunning views of Nanga Parbat, the world's ninth-highest mountain. - *Deosai National Park*: Home to a variety of wildlife, including the Himalayan brown bear and snow leopards. - *Minimarg*: A scenic town with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. - *Rupal Valley*: Known for its stunning scenery and trekking opportunities. Activities - *Trekking*: Explore the valley's vast wilderness and enjoy stunning views. - *Camping*: Set up camp by the river or in designated campsites. - *Fishing*: Try your luck at catching trout in the valley's streams. Tour Packages Rozefs Tourism offers a 4-day tour package to Astore Valley, including: - *Hotel Accommodation*: Stay in comfortable hotels with scenic views. - *Tour Guide*: Explore the valley with an experienced guide. - *Transportation*: Travel in comfort with transportation services. - *Breakfast*: Enjoy delicious breakfasts at hotels. Reviews Travelers have praised Astore Valley for its stunning scenery and warm hospitality. One reviewer mentioned that the tour exceeded their expectations, with breathtaking views of Nanga Parbat and excellent services from Rozefs Tourism . Essential Information - *Location*: Astore Valley is located in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. - *Best Time to Visit*: Summer months (June to September) are ideal for visiting. - *Getting There*: The valley is accessible by road, with the nearest airport in Gilgit. Overall, Astore Valley is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Its stunning scenery, diverse wildlife, and range of activities make it an unforgettable experience.

combined_text: Neelum Valley Riverside Dhabas Riverside Dining Small, rustic eateries along the Neelum River serving fresh trout and karahi with the sound of flowing water. Neelum Valley, Kashmir, is a captivating paradise at 4,0007,500 ft elevation, stretching around 200 km from Muzaffarabad (about 100 km away) and nearly 250 km from Islamabad. This valley is adorned with lush pine forests, mesmerizing waterfalls, and the ever-charming Neelum River winding alongside snowcapped mountains. From Kale Sector to Sharda Valley and further onwards to Taobutt, every turn unfolds a postcard view filled with serenity and charm. In earlier days, the roads beyond Muzaffarabad were rough and challenging, though recent developments may have improved accessibility. Despite the journey, the reward is unmatchedserene landscapes, fresh mountain air, and untouched natural beauty that leave all hustle and bustle behind. Autumn colors, snowy winters, and summer blossoms make Neelum Valley an all-season wonder. For travelers, photographers, and adventurers, it is a must-visit gem of Azad Kashmir, offering timeless beauty that redefines peace and wanderlust in Pakistans northern valleys. Recommended to go if you have no heart issues lols, as the track which you have to cover from jeep looks dangerous.. Well really good place to visit. Ratti Gali Lake is a breathtaking alpine lake located in Neelum Valley, Azad Kashmir. Surrounded by snow-capped mountains and lush green meadows, this glacial lake offers crystal-clear blue waters and stunning natural beauty. The journey to the lake involves a thrilling jeep ride from Dowarian and a short trek, making it a perfect adventure for nature lovers. Visitors are mesmerized by the serene atmosphere, wildflowers, and scenic landscapes. The best time to visit is between July and September when the weather is pleasant, and the lake is fully accessible. However, travelers should be cautious during the jeep ride, as the road can be rough and narrow. Amazing beauty, clean, calm, pure nature, must visit. Distance from base is short, if your legs are good, don't hire horse.

In Pakistan's Azad Jammu and Kashmir province's Hattian Bala District, there is an agricultural valley called the Leepa Valley. It's around 83 kilometres (52 miles) from Muzaffarabad, the nation's capital.The valley is separated into the Nowkot, Kasirkot, Dao Khan, Leepa, and Chananian sections. The interesting facts about this valley is that people of Leepa is live near to the nature and you can feel the major difference the life style of this valley as compared to other Kashmir region.The road condition is also satisfactory. Famous Tourist attraction in this valley are Daokhan, Nowkot Rice field (Best in the world), old tradition Rice and Flour Chakki (old concept of rice/flour mill), and Chananian. There are several hotals available in this valley for stay with appropriate facilities.This valley is highly recommended for vist and prince guest house offer best view of the beautiful rice filed. Leepa is very beautiful village at AJ kashmir.beauty of village can not be describe in words.it is heaven on earth.every thing of basic need is available hotels and restaurants.people of leepa village are very polite and helpfull. combined_text: Kaghan Valley Lassi Stalls Lassi Stall Thick, creamy lassi served in clay cups by the roadside, a refreshing drink during travel. Kaghan Valley is a breathtakingly beautiful destination in the Mansehra District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. Known for its lush green mountains, crystal-clear lakes, flowing rivers, and scenic villages, its one of the top tourist spots in northern Pakistan. From the charming town of Balakot to the alpine lake Saif ul Maluk, the entire valley is filled with natural wonders. Places like Naran, Siri Paye, Lulusar Lake, and Babusar Top offer unforgettable views and cool weather, especially during summer. The valley is perfect for family trips, nature photography, hiking, and relaxing away from city life. Local hospitality, fresh trout fish, and jeep rides to highland areas add to the experience. Roads can be rough in some parts, so careful planning is advised. Kaghan Valley is a true gem for nature lovers and a must-visit destination for anyone exploring northern Pakistan. The fresh air, stunning views, and peaceful surroundings will refresh your soul. Kaghan Valley is one of the most beautiful places I have ever visited. Surrounded by lush green mountains, flowing rivers, and breathtaking landscapes, this valley is a true paradise for nature lovers. From the moment I entered the valley, the cool, fresh air and picturesque views made me feel at peace. One of the highlights of my trip was visiting Lake Saif-ul-Mulook. The emerald-green lake, set against the backdrop of snow-covered peaks, was absolutely mesmerizing. A boat ride on the lake was a magical experience. I also explored Babusar Top, which offered panoramic views of the entire valley and was perfect for photography. The hospitality of the locals made my trip even more special. They were incredibly kind and welcoming, always ready to share their culture and traditions. I also enjoyed the local food, especially Trout fish from the Kunhar River, which was fresh and delicious. Driving through the winding roads of Kaghan Valley, surrounded by waterfalls and dense forests, was an adventure in itself. Whether you love hiking, sightseeing, or just relaxing in nature, Kaghan Valley has something for everyone. I highly recommend visiting this stunning destination  I cant wait to go back

combined_text: Hunza Apricot Cake Bakeries Local Bakery Local bakeries specializing in cakes and jams made from the famous Hunza apricots. Stopped by this cafe and was genuinely impressed! The views were absolutely stunning  a perfect backdrop to a relaxing meal. The staff was friendly and efficient, and the place itself was spotless and neatly kept. I had a sandwich and a milkshake, both were delicious. Now I totally get why this spot comes so highly recommended whenever youre in Hunza Delicious breakfast with a view! Had breakfast at the much-anticipated Cafe de Hunza, and it lived up to the hype! Its a self-service cafe and usually a bit crowded, but we went early right after opening and got a cozy spot. We ordered their famous walnut cake, pancake with Nutella, brownie, Pakistani complete breakfast, cheese & mushroom omelette, regular tea, and the refreshing Hunza tea with honey. Everything was superb! The pancake was freshly baked, the omelette was creamy and flavorful, and the walnut cake truly deserves its reputationmoist, rich, and unforgettable The Hunza tea had a light, herbal punch with honey that was both refreshing and unique. It cost us Rs. 5,600 for 9 people, which is quite reasonable for such quality food and ambience. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Hunza! I found the famous walnut cake good but not exceptional. It was quite dry and the texture wasnt soft and moist like a cake, but more like a biscuit. The rose tea was great though, highly recommend that. And the decor is cute.

This morning, our team of eight visited this historic archaeological site located approximately 6 to 7 miles from the Serena Hotel in GilgitBaltistan, Pakistan. The drive took about an hour due to the unpaved roads. One of the main attractions at the site was the impressive Buddha statue carved into a mountain, along with the rich history that accompanies it. The area is surrounded by beautiful, towering mountains, offering stunning views that make you feel as if you could almost reach out and touch them. We spent about an hour and a half exploring the site and learning about its history with our tour guide. It's important to note that the drive was quite bumpy, as most of the route consists of unpaved roads, which can make for a difficult ride. However, the experience was well worth it to see this historic site. If authorities were to improve the roads, the site could accommodate many more visitors. An amazing archeological site with an amazing famous story/ tales by locals. Well maintained, good for national and international tourists. Must visit site if you're in Gilgit region, very close to Gilgit city approximately 20 minutes drive from city center. Very affordable ticket price. Parking facility is5 bit congested as most of cars are parked road side (due to area). Car can go all the way up to site, with a little walk only. Kids can easily. It has a beautiful view of Kargah Nallah (stream), breathtaking view from top. Buddha De Yasheni in Kargah, Gilgit, a beautiful place to visit. Also sacred for followers of Buddha. The carving in stone dates back to 7th century.

Babusar Top  A Piece of Heaven on Earth Visiting Babusar Top is like stepping into a dream. Nestled high in the mountains at over 13,000 feet, this breathtaking spot offers panoramic views that are beyond words  snow-capped peaks, lush green valleys, and clouds so close you feel like you can touch them. The journey to the top is equally mesmerizing, with winding roads, cascading waterfalls, and scenic landscapes at every turn. The cool breeze, peaceful silence, and majestic beauty make it a perfect escape from the hustle of city life. Whether youre a nature lover, photographer, or simply someone in search of peace, Babusar Top is a must-visit. Truly one of Pakistans most beautiful treasures.  What an incredible place! I visited with my family on June 25th. Just imagine one day you're enduring Karachi's scorching heat, and within two days, you're wrapped in a jacket, breathing in the fresh air, and soaking in breathtaking mountain views. It's an unforgettable experience you'll cherish forever. Not easy to reach, must have a car with proper tuned and powerful engine. 13700ft high is where you will feel breathing pressure. Amazing sceneries. Addiction to go beyond and more.

Phandar Valley, a hidden gem in Pakistan's Gilgit-Baltistan region, is renowned for its breathtaking landscapes and tranquil ambiance. Nestled amidst lush green fields and framed by snow-capped peaks, this valley is home to the serene Phandar Lake, where the water shifts in mesmerizing shades of blue and green. Known as "Little Kashmir," Phandar offers a perfect retreat for nature lovers, with opportunities for fishing, hiking, and peaceful boat rides. This picturesque valley has a rich cultural heritage and remains a peaceful escape for travelers seeking unspoiled natural beauty, making it a must-visit destination in northern Pakistan.

Shandur Polo Ground, perched at around 3,700m (12,200ft) above sea level, is one of the most breathtaking and unique tourist experiences you'll ever encounter. If you're a nature lover, culture buff, or all of the above, Shandur Polo Ground delivers a spectacular, soul-stirring adventure. Highly recommended! A beauty in simple words no internet no mobile just simple nature 6.30hrs long pure off-road track leads you to 1200ft above the sea level with wonderful scenery. World highest polo ground every year host 65k people to witness free style international polo between Gilgilt and Chitral. Rating:  Shandur National Park, nestled in the heart of the majestic Hindu Kush mountain range in Pakistan, is a pristine wilderness that showcases the breathtaking beauty of nature. With its awe-inspiring landscapes, diverse wildlife, and unique cultural experiences, Shandur National Park deserves a resounding five-star review. One of the most captivating aspects of Shandur National Park is its awe-inspiring landscapes. Nestled at an elevation of around 3,700 meters, the park offers panoramic views of rolling hills, sprawling meadows, and snow-capped peaks. The vast expanse of greenery during the summer months is a sight to behold, while the snow-covered terrain during winter adds a touch of magic to the surroundings. The park's rich biodiversity is another highlight that attracts nature enthusiasts. Shandur National Park is home to a wide array of wildlife species, including Himalayan ibex, snow leopards, brown bears, and various bird species. Exploring the park provides opportunities for wildlife spotting and birdwatching, offering a glimpse into the wonders of the natural world. Shandur National Park is also famous for its cultural significance. The annual Shandur Polo Festival, held on the highest polo ground in the world, is a major attraction for both locals and tourists. The festival showcases the traditional sport of polo played on horseback, offering a unique blend of thrilling matches and cultural performances. It provides an opportunity to immerse oneself in the local culture, witness traditional dances, and savor the flavors of regional cuisine. For adventure seekers, Shandur National Park offers a multitude of activities. The vast meadows provide ample space for camping, hiking, and horseback riding, allowing visitors to experience the park's pristine beauty up close. Additionally, the park is a gateway to numerous trekking trails that lead to hidden valleys, high-altitude lakes, and remote villages, offering a truly immersive adventure in the lap of nature. The infrastructure within Shandur National Park has seen improvements in recent years, with well-maintained trails, camping facilities, and accommodations available for visitors. The efforts to preserve the park's natural beauty and promote sustainable tourism ensure that visitors can enjoy its wonders while minimizing their impact on the environment. In conclusion, Shandur National Park is a treasure trove of natural beauty and cultural heritage. Its breathtaking landscapes, diverse wildlife, and unique cultural experiences make it an ideal destination for nature lovers, adventure enthusiasts, and those seeking an immersive cultural experience. Prepare to be captivated by the park's grandeur, embrace the local traditions, and create memories that will last a lifetime. Shandur National Park is a true gem that deserves its place among the world's most remarkable natural wonders.

combined_text: Deosai Plains Shepherd's Cheese Artisanal Cheese Shepherds in the Deosai Plains sometimes sell or offer samples of their homemade cheese. Deosai Plains, located in Gilgit-Baltistan, are among the highest plateaus in the world, often called the Land of Giants. Spanning lush green fields, snowcapped peaks, and wildflower meadows, the plains offer breathtaking views and a serene atmosphere. Visitors often spot wildlife like Himalayan brown bears and golden marmots. Accessible mainly during summer, Deosai is ideal for camping, photography, and nature lovers seeking peace and raw beauty. Its untouched charm makes it one of Pakistans most unique natural wonders. Heaven on Earth.. I been traveling Northern Areas of Pakistan since long, but this is the Jewel in Crown.. Amazing Scenery, breath taking views, cold streams, Lovely flowers, and chirping birds.. Nature has been kind to it.. It's sad to find Tourists littering the place. Me and My friend collected 2 bags full and deposited them at bins erected by local authorities.. Also plz don't put Loud Music into here, sound pollution is a hazard, and quite a few foreign tourists were complaining about it.. We rented a tent by a stream, its affordable, but sanitary conditions are appalling.. The quilts and pillows had mould and bugs.. Food served is NOT good for Health, You had to tell them thrice, what you wanted. Local people are polite and smiling all the time, Tourists should respect their culture and customs.. If you are with family, My humble advice is that in present sanitary conditions don't stay for Night, Skardu is nearby on 3 hours drive, rest there .. A must visit place for hikers and nature lovers ..  The Deosai Plains, also known as the Deosai National Park, are located in northern Pakistan, primarily in the Skardu District of Gilgit-Baltistan. They are one of the highest plateaus in the world, situated at an average altitude of about 4,114 meters (13,497 feet) above sea level. This breathtaking expanse of natural beauty spans approximately 3,000 square kilometers (1,158 square miles) and is often referred to as the "Land of Giants." Key Features 1. Stunning Landscape: The plains are known for their wide-open spaces, rolling hills, and lush green meadows during the summer months. In the spring, the area is covered with a vibrant blanket of wildflowers, creating a stunning contrast against the snow-capped mountains surrounding it. 2. Flora and Fauna: Deosai is home to unique wildlife, including the Himalayan brown bear, which is an endangered species. Other animals include red foxes, golden marmots, ibex, and snow leopards. The park also hosts a variety of migratory birds and butterflies. 3. Sheosar Lake: The park features the breathtaking Sheosar Lake, one of the highest lakes in the world. The name "Sheosar" means "Blind Lake" in the local language. The lake is renowned for its crystal-clear waters and mesmerizing reflections of the surrounding peaks. 4. Climate: The area experiences extreme weather, with harsh winters and a relatively short summer. During winter, the plains are covered in heavy snow, making them inaccessible for months. 5. Cultural and Historical Significance: Deosai has cultural importance to the local communities and is mentioned in many folklore and legends. 6. Tourism: It is a popular destination for adventurers, photographers, and nature lovers. Activities such as camping, trekking, and stargazing are common, especially during the summer season. Accessibility The Deosai Plains can be accessed via Skardu or Astore. The roads to the park are rugged and challenging, often requiring off-road vehicles. The best time to visit is from June to September when the snow has melted, and the area is accessible. The Deosai Plains are a testament to Pakistan's diverse natural beauty and a must-visit destination for those seeking serenity and adventure in the wilderness.

combined_text: Passu Cathedral View Cafe Scenic Cafe A cafe strategically placed to offer unimpeded views of the Passu Cathedrals with a cup of tea. This was by far our highlight in Hunza. Rahim was a great host. The rooms are very cozy and warm, great hot shower and the cleanest rooms and bathrooms by far. Also Rahim took us hiking to the 2 glaciers, the Passu Cones, Passu and Husseini bridge, we had the best time and views in Pakistan. Rahim also prepares a very nice breakfast. Can highly recommend!!!!! Had a great stay at Cathedral view.. location is perfect with a great view!! Rahim is super friendly and has a great knowledge about the area and Hunza in general! Place was warm...clean.. comfortable.. felt very good will sure stay again when back in Passu.! I stayed at Cathedral View 3 times from end-April to early-May. Rahim operates a hostel-style arrangement in a traditional living room set-up, making it quite affordable for solo travellers. WiFi is available and is pretty good for Gojal - certainly the best you'll get in Passu. Rahim himself is a wealth of knowledge, both of local info and for tourist treks in the area. He helped arrange a guide for the Patundas trek as well, which was cheaper than other options I'd explored, including from Ghulkin. And of course, the view of the Passu Cones is spectacular. There's an option for breakfast (although note, not lunch or dinner - for that Passu has many other options), and having breakfast while looking at the Cones is a definite highlight. I really enjoyed my stay and completely recommend it to anyone in the area.

"Astore Valley: Breathtaking scenery, rich history, and warm hospitality. A hidden gem in Gilgit-Baltistan, perfect for trekking, camping, and nature lovers." A journey you will never forget. Astore Valley is a stunning and peaceful destination in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. Surrounded by snow-covered mountains and green meadows, it's perfect for nature lovers and trekkers. The valley offers fresh air, clean water, and beautiful views all around. Places like Rama Lake and Deosai Plains are nearby and add more beauty to the area. Roads can be rough, but the experience is worth it. Astore Valley is a breathtakingly beautiful destination in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan, known for its stunning scenery, diverse wildlife, and adventure activities. Here's what you can expect: Scenic Beauty The valley offers picturesque views of lush green meadows, towering mountains, and crystal-clear streams. The scenery is particularly breathtaking during the summer months when wildflowers bloom in vibrant colors. Places to Visit - *Rama Lake*: A popular spot with stunning views of Nanga Parbat, the world's ninth-highest mountain. - *Deosai National Park*: Home to a variety of wildlife, including the Himalayan brown bear and snow leopards. - *Minimarg*: A scenic town with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. - *Rupal Valley*: Known for its stunning scenery and trekking opportunities. Activities - *Trekking*: Explore the valley's vast wilderness and enjoy stunning views. - *Camping*: Set up camp by the river or in designated campsites. - *Fishing*: Try your luck at catching trout in the valley's streams. Tour Packages Rozefs Tourism offers a 4-day tour package to Astore Valley, including: - *Hotel Accommodation*: Stay in comfortable hotels with scenic views. - *Tour Guide*: Explore the valley with an experienced guide. - *Transportation*: Travel in comfort with transportation services. - *Breakfast*: Enjoy delicious breakfasts at hotels. Reviews Travelers have praised Astore Valley for its stunning scenery and warm hospitality. One reviewer mentioned that the tour exceeded their expectations, with breathtaking views of Nanga Parbat and excellent services from Rozefs Tourism . Essential Information - *Location*: Astore Valley is located in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. - *Best Time to Visit*: Summer months (June to September) are ideal for visiting. - *Getting There*: The valley is accessible by road, with the nearest airport in Gilgit. Overall, Astore Valley is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Its stunning scenery, diverse wildlife, and range of activities make it an unforgettable experience.

combined_text: Burns Road Food Street Food Street Hub The heart of Karachi's street food scene, famous for bun kebabs, nihari, and katakat. Very diverse range of food available, the only issue you will face is parking and too much traffic Burns Road is truly the heart of Karachi's food culture!If you're a food lover, this place is a must-visit. From traditional kebabs specially dhaga kabab of delhi kabab house ,haleem, and bun kebabs to mouthwatering desserts like rabri and falooda,icecream, you'll find everything here in one street. The food is rich in flavor, authentic, and represents Karachi's heritage perfectly. The atmosphere is always lively, full of families, friends, and tourists enjoying late-night meals. It's busy and bustling, but that's part of the charm. The prices are very reasonable compared to the quality and variety you get. Parking can sometimes be tricky, and the area can get crowded, but the taste and experience are absolutely worth it. Burns Road is not just food, it's a complete Karachi experience. Highly recommended! If you like a rushy area with a variety of food restaurants, then you must visit this place. The taste and spices are in perfect condition.

combined_text: Butt Karahi Mutton Karahi The original and most famous karahi spot in Lahore's Lakshmi Chowk. Great taste. . . . Butt Karahi is a renowned restaurant famous for its traditional Pakistani chicken karahi dish, with its origin in Lahore, Pakistan. The original establishment, founded in 1953, is known for its authentic flavors and a busy, no-frills atmosphere, particularly in the Lakshmi Chowk area. Its success has led to multiple branches in Lahore claiming to be the original and many imitators, as well as international franchises in places like Canada and the UK. History and origin Butt Karahi was founded in Lahore in 1953 and is considered a culinary icon in Pakistan. The original restaurant is located in the bustling Lakshmi Chowk area. The restaurant's success has led to numerous copycat restaurants and franchise locations appearing in Lahore and other parts of the world. The dish The restaurant is most famous for its "desi" (traditional) chicken karahi. Karahi is a dish named after the wok-like pot it is cooked in, and the Butt Karahi version is known for its rich, spicy, and tomatoey base, often finished with ginger, black pepper, and butter. Recipes have been passed down through generations, and while they use high-quality ingredients, the specific spice blend is a closely guarded secre Taste of food is good but they only take cash payments to avoid tax. I don't know why they are not ready to pay taxes. Butt karahi, The moment the sizzling hot karahi arrived, the aroma had me drooling. And the flavors? Absolutely divine! The meat was tender, juicy, and cooked to perfection. The spices were balanced, with just the right amount of heat. The quarter portion was not so generous for a single person though size. The service was average but friendly, attentive, and accommodating. But took me an over an hour to receive my order. The ambiance was okayish. If you're a karahi lover, Scrumptious Butt Karahi is a MUST-TRY! If you have parience to wait. Be prepared for an explosion of flavors that'll leave you craving more. Recommended for: Karahi enthusiasts, spice lovers, and anyone seeking an unforgettable dining experience!

combined_text: Lahori Doodh Jalebi Jalebi / Doodh A historic spot in Lahore's Akbari Gate, famous for its hot jalebis dipped in cold milk. Firstly they are using the name of GRATO jalebi but now I think due to crack down on trademark issue they start using name of crispy. Thanks to institutions for making thing right. About taste yes very good taste and especially during raining season and night huge crowd gathered to take the bite. About cleanliness same traditional safai in kitchen area and serving area which need to be take care to start journey towards mega brand. Grato Jalebi is situated near Camp Jail in front of LS stop and at the corner of road coming from Shadman and meeting with Ferozpur Road, Lahore - Pakistan. This Jalebi is a sweet dish in Pakistan, specially in Punjab. This Grato Jalebi is originally from Rawalpindi and they do have a restaurant in Islamabad as well. In Lahore they have made around 4 to 5 branches. They do have Jalebi with sugar free mode as well and also with less sugar. These modes of Jalebi is being launched in a week or so from now. Along with Jalebi they have already launched samosas, a fried snack of south Asian countries. The prices are a bit higher but taste is very good so it's worth trying. Seating isn't available by so only takeouts are offered. Amazing Jalebi, mouth watering, finger licking good. The taste is so good that you cant resist eating. Only ask for fresh and hot Jalebi, if they are not fresh then you wont enjoy it. The also have amazing Gulabjamans and you must try them too. Both these sweets are just too good and you will love them. They also have very tasty Pakoray, their pakoray are with potato fires and potato makes their Pakoray really good. I havent tried but they also serve chicken and vegitable Samosay and Rolls, they looked good too. Overall it was a very good experience and I would recommed you to visit this place.

combined_text: Haji Sher Muhammad Sohan Halwa The most famous name for "Sohan Halwa" in Multan, a city renowned for this sweet. Marble is too hot to walk during summer  The Baba Haji Sher Dewan Shrine in Sardar Pur Jhandir, formerly known as Kothewal, is a revered site honoring the spiritual journey of Baba Haji Sher Muhammad Dewan Chawali Mashaikh, originally Rai Chawala. This sacred destination attracts countless devotees seeking solace, blessings, and guidance. It stands as a testament to Baba Haji Sher's teachings of love, humility, and unity, fostering a deep spiritual connection among visitors from diverse backgrounds. Renowned as South Asia's first shrine, it holds historical significance dating back to its construction under Sultan Mahmood Ghaznavi and renovations by Mughal Emperor Jahangir and Dewan Mool Raj. The shrine's tranquil environment and nearby Khoi Baba Farid well, where Baba Fariduddin Ganjshakar meditated, add to its spiritual allure, making it a place of profound meditation and spiritual rejuvenation for all who visit. Very spiritual place. I feel very relaxed whenever visited there

combined_text: Dhamthal Halwa Shop Sohan Halwa A legendary roadside stop on the GT Road famous for its irresistible, piping hot sohan halwa. This is the go-to spot for me as my Nana's apartment is right on that street so whenever I visit I eat there, and I have to say that the quality has not changed much it still has a very nice taste and honestly dhamtal has adapted quite well to staying competitive. There is a lot more cleanliness now then last time I visited. Staff is helpful and nice even though the bakery is quite busy all the time. Atmosphere is a little bit of negative point for the bakery dine in is very difficult, it's quite rushy and it is not even worth it. My recommendation is to take-out. Another thing that i am quite surprised about is the prices. Prices have not changed much and i admired that 8bje ye cake inki shop se lia tha aik dum bassi or boosa hua complain krne pr kehdia k aisa he hta he fridge me rkh k khalain pathetic service , 0 quality food must try their cake before purchase to safe yourself from wasting your money video review coming soon on fb, yt ans insta on Ather_k_vlog Visited on a Sunday morning with friends for breakfast. This place is quite hyped for its traditional halwa puri in Karachi, but I found it just average compared to other options like DilPasand (Nazimabad) or Hafiz (Malir). We sat on the roadside footpath , which gave a very basic vibedefinitely an area that could use some improvement for more comfortable outdoor seating. We ordered the classic halwa with puri, along with channay, aaloo tarkari, and achaar. While the service was fine, the puri was overly oily and the halwa could have been better in taste . Prices are moderate at around 300-500 per head, and breakfast is available until about 12 PM on weekends. They do offer separate seating for families inside, but we didn't get to try that out. Overall, if you're looking to try a popular spot, it's worth a visitbut don't expect it to exceed your expectations.

combined_text: Lahori Fish Fry Fish Fry Iconic spots in Lahore, like at Mozang Chungi, famous for their spicy, fried fish. If youre looking for the true Siddique Fish experience, this is the real and authentic branch to visit. They specialize in perfectly fried fish, cooked in high-quality mustard oil for a rich and traditional flavor. We ordered Rahu fish, and it was simply outstanding. Crispy on the outside, tender and juicy inside, with spices that were perfectly balanced. The cleanliness and freshness of the fish were evident, making the meal even more enjoyable. The service was excellent, with a courteous staff ensuring a smooth and pleasant dining experience. For all fish lovers, Siddique Fish is a must-try! You wont be disappointed. It was used to be a good spot for fish but my this experience on 03-JAN-2025 was a total disappointment. The rates a too exaggerated merely because of the hype. Fish was not properly fried, it was still watery and not fully cooked. It was served dripping of oil and oil too wasn't seeming like of quality. A total disappointment. Not a big fan of sweet water fish, untill I tried it here. Very good taste and fresh. Service, ordering in advance & payment, its all an absolute hassle, even in dine-in.

combined_text: Hyderabadi Biryani House Biryani Famous for its authentic Hyderabadi-style biryani in Karachi. I've been a customer at Master Biryani for the last 30 years. When it comes to biryani restaurants, Master Biryani stands out as a lesser-known option compared to other biryani places, but for me, this is my all time favorite place for Biryani. What I really enjoy about their biryani is the unique flavor of the rice and biryani spices, along with the tasty potatoes and tender chicken. This biryani, in my opinion, is the best in Karachi. If you're around the old area, New Chali, or near Bolton Market, I suggest you try it at least once. Currently, a plate of biryani costs Rs. 280, which might be due to the overall increase in prices. The place is somewhat  accessible for people with different abilities, but parking can be a problem here. one of the oldest and best place for biryani lover offering chicken beef and fish biryani as well. also serving fry fish and other curries with orti chappati. fthe taste of biryani is somehow very incline to hyderabadi style biryani and i believe that is originated from any other state of india . we tried chixken and beef but missed to taste fish Kund biryani or fry. only available at lunch time due to vicinity of business area. combined_text: Waris Nihari Nihari A famous name in Lahore's Mughalpura area, known for its flavorful and hearty nihari. Finally got the chance to try Waris Nihari in Anarkali  its been on my list for a long time since theres so much hype around it and food bloggers seem to go crazy for it. Honestly, I found it a bit overhyped. First of all, the price is quite high  a small nihari costs Rs. 900. Yes, the portion is enough for two people, but still feels expensive compared to other places. The taste was good but not something out of this world or worth the massive hype. Service was another downside. I was expecting quick service for such a famous spot, but it was really slow  felt like it took forever just to get our order. Overall, its worth trying once for the experience and to see what the hype is about, but in my opinion, it doesnt fully live up to the reputation. Recently visited waris nehari with my friend. Overall experience was good. We ordered their nali nehari. If we talk about taste, I would say it was one the best nehari i ever tried. Although the environment and sitting arrangement was not well, but the taste and food quality was very good. If you want to feel old Androon Lahore vibes and taste authentic nali nehari in Lahore, Pakistan, Waris is one the best option. Ill go again for sure. It tasted pure, sumptuous...almost spiritual. The server was quite helpful. Atmosphere at the Anarkali market branch was average- I was on the ground floor (not the family lounge) and expected a little better. You need air conditioner to consume that much fat! All in all, the place deserves its fame. Highly recommended.

combined_text: Chacha Feeka Street Food (Feeka) An iconic, decades-old cart in Lahore's Anarkali Bazaar, famous for its "Feeka" (a spiced chickpea snack). We tried khoey wali lassi. It was very thick and heavy. Taste was excellent. We tried after breakfast but I think there is no need to take breakfast if you are going to try Feekay ki Lassi! 27/7/25 I am a Lahori, but I first heard about this lassi about 10 years back, around 2015. This was my first visit here. I first went to Jeda Lassi, but it was sold out at 8:20AM as it was Sunday. So I drove here instead. I ordered the expensive version: 350/glass Pera lassi. Dahi lassi is 200/glass. The guy churns the butter in front of you for 10 mins, and makes the lassi with the watery butter milk! They crushed ice (must be from some factory, so no exactly hygienic) in a 50kg sugar sack and added a palm full to the glass. Then he scooped out butter with his palm and put it on top of the watery lassi. Then crushed and added Rs.50 worth of perra on top. So this version of lassi is buttermilk with 2 toppings. With a spoon, you eat the very sugary peera with some butter and then sip the thin lassi. Milk quality was meh as per my assessment, but then again, I didn't exactly have pure milk, only this diluted butter milk. I don't like sugar overdose. So this was perfect for me that the only sugar it had was in the perra so you can basically take as much or little sweetness as you like with a spoon with each sip. From the vloggers, I had heard that it is very filling and you can't finish it. This was my breakfast, and I can tell you it filled me decently, but it was not difficult to finish. I think pera lassi is unique and not available widely elsewhere so you can come try it. My favourite lassi so far is the thick, creamy Tariq sweets lassi on hall road. Visit 2: 14/9/25 Went for Dahi lassi. Very little malai added on top and sweetness level was a bit high for me. Milk quality was just okay, and even dahi lassi wasn't very thick. It was a decent 7/10. It wasn't filling enough for me as breakfast, so I went to test the Tariq sweets lassi on hall road right after it for a proper comparison. Tariq had very good milk quality, very creamy and thick yogurt and just the right amount of sugar. The milk fat sticks to your tongue. But the malai topping was so much and so thick that it felt fake cornflour to me. Overall, I would rate that 9/10. Bakwas dirty not the worth at all, looked like the yogurt was not fresh nor the milk. Really disappointed if this is the original feeka lassi. I really doubt this is the og feeka lassi correct me if I m wrong. In comparison ambala milk shop faisal town lassi 140 pkr awesome fresh disposable glass cold. But this one I will not recommend any one.

combined_text: Lahori Chanay Wala Channay A historic spot in Lahore's Akbari Mandi, serving its famous channay since 1940. This place carries the soul of old Lahore. From the GPO Orange Line station, its hardly a one-kilometer walk, yet it feels like youre stepping back in time. The narrow streets, the timeless atmosphere, and the simple charm make it more than just a spotits a memory lane. Most of the people youll find here are loyal customers whove been visiting for generations. That mix of familiarity and tradition is what makes it so special. If you want to taste the spirit of old Lahore, this is where it lingers. Food is outstanding espacially  Cleanliness position is not good. They should work on interior for attracting families If someone wants to taste the real flavor of channay with very little spices, then this place is literally the best. Not everyone will like its taste because its not like the regular channay that are loaded with spices. The raita and salad are good, and it surely serves the best channay in its own category. The service and cleanliness are not up to the mark

combined_text: Lahori Kulfi Kulfi Stalls in Lahore's Old City, especially around Mochi Gate, famous for traditional kulfi. Their falooda is rich, creamy, and full of authentic flavor  a perfect mix of kulfi, vermicelli, and rose syrup. The hygiene isnt great, as its a typical street-style spot. But if you can overlook that, the taste makes it totally worth it. Highly recommended for those who value flavor over fancy surroundings! Yousaf Falooda in Purani Anarkali has earned its reputation for a reason. Their Rabri Milk (Rabri Doodh) is rich, creamy, and perfectly sweetened, making it a refreshing treat on its own. The Falooda is the highlight, loaded with flavor, smooth textures, and always served fresh  truly one of the best in Lahore. And their famous Kulfi (Kulfi) is simply irresistible, with a traditional taste that brings back old memories and makes it a must-try for visitors. The service is generally attentive and efficient, though it can slow down a little during rush hours. The atmosphere is lively and carries the old Anarkali charm, but it often feels crowded, especially in peak times. Overall, Yousaf Falooda is a classic stop for anyone looking to enjoy authentic traditional desserts with unforgettable taste. Yousaf Faloda Shop Old Anakali Lahore Is one of my Childhood love, As we use to live in old Anarkali their shop Owners were friends of my late grandfather. And we use to go to this shop very often specially in summers evening, That time shop was very fancy seating was very beautiful shop was decorated with glass cut work like shesh mehal, And their Faloda was made with reach and original milk tasted so amazing, Also their flavored chilled milk was very nice and yougart was thik , Lassi was amazing as well, Over all it was a paradise for Falooda Lovers , but as of now their quality is bit down and have some hygiene issues as well. But still when I use to go Anarkali Bazar use to try it.

combined_text: Karachi's Iceberg Ice Cream Parlor One of the oldest and most famous ice cream parlors in the city. Iceberg is that ice cream place which has been the first choice of Karachiites for decades. Especially their innovative flavors like Geto, Sicilian, Rose Rabri, Strawberry Cheesecake, and Mango are extremely popular, particularly in my family, where theyre loved by everyone. None of our family gatherings ever feel complete without Icebergs ice cream, no matter what the season is. Most of the time, weve taken it as takeaway, but last week we happened to dine in, and it was even more enjoyable, this time I tried their Kulfi Falooda, and it was amazing. The sitting area is small but beautifully designed, with a few chairs outside as well if you prefer not to sit in the chilled AC. And because of this setup, the place is completely accessible for wheelchair users. Car parking, however, can be an issue here, as everyone knows the usual traffic situation in Saddar. Website is not updated according to the availability of an item. I ordered 3 icecream flavors Pomegranate, Shareefa and the Anjeer. Shareefa wasn't available so I asked to change it with Kaju Rabri. Kaju Rabri was good. Ajeer was fine but Pomegranate ice-cream is actually refrigerated pomegranate juice (Disappointed). There is a big room for improvement. Iceberg Ice Cream is one of famous ice cream spot in Karachi. They are located on Daud Pota Road and in a very busy area. Their shop is not very spacious although they have some sitting arrangements in their shop. Too much customers in shop make it very rushy place. Their ice cream taste is also good with different prices of different flavoured scoopes. Overall it's a nice place for ice cream lovers.

combined_text: Lahore's Phajji Ke Paye Paye A legendary spot in Lahore's Ichhra Bazaar, famous for its paye (trotters). We ordered their Bong Paye with Mikh (Beef Shank Meat with Beef Trotters and Bone Marrow) and Chota Paya with bone marrow (Mutton Trotter with Bone Marrow). The taste was delicious, mouthwatering and satisfying. Their Maghz (Brain) is top notch which was already finished when we reached at 11:00AM. I had a very bad experience. Expensive and and the smallest laal Botti I have ever seen in a bong. Picture is from 2 plates that we bought as take out. 900 rupees per plate and teaspoon size meat in each plate. Heard many good reviews about this place so on a cold morning decided to try bong paaye here. Location: it's on the main allama Iqbal road so you don't need to cover a long distance once you take right term after the dharampura railway line. The place: it's on the first floor of a building with a quite bad entrance for families Maybe but once you enter the first floor, it's neat and clean with dining halls on both sides. The one on the right side is the family hall. Food: coming to the main item. We ordered full bong paaye with mekh (bone marrow/ guuda). The quantity was excellent for two people. Along with it, we'd naan which were excellent. Bong paaye looked good if not very appealing. The good thing was that there wasn't any bad smell (which often comes in commercially made paaye) coming out of it but the taste itself was quite bland..I mean it doesn't satisfy the appetite for paaye...it wasn't bad either but it was also not something worth coming back also. You can visit this place without expecting some extraordinary taste. They've their own tandoor so naans come super hot and they're something I definitely loved. Service: excellent service. The guy was super active always asking the customers if they need anything else. Replacing cold naans with the hot ones and serving extra gravy as well. Full marks for the service.

combined_text: Karachi's Balochi Sajji Balochi Sajji Restaurants specializing in the Balochi-style whole roasted lamb or chicken. Their menu boasts a variety of tasty options. Chicken and mutton dishes are cooked to perfection, bursting with flavor. The biryani is aromatic and satisfying. But the real star of the show is the sajji, a succulent roasted meat that's a must-try. For those in the mood for fast food, they have you covered with delicious options. The outdoor setting adds to the charm, making your meal feel even more enjoyable. The staff is friendly, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. Prices are reasonable, making it accessible for everyone. Balouchi Saji and Koyla Karahi are ideal for a casual outing with friends or family. Whether you're craving traditional desi flavors or fast food treats, this place has something for everyone. And the outdoor seating adds a refreshing touch to your mealtime. Went to this eatery on November 11,2023 We ordered chicken Sajji, mutton Boti along with roti (bread) Food we ordered was delicious and portions were good. combined_text: Lahore's Street Jalebi Jalebi Hot, crispy jalebis sold from carts across the city, especially in the old quarters. Firstly they are using the name of GRATO jalebi but now I think due to crack down on trademark issue they start using name of crispy. Thanks to institutions for making thing right. About taste yes very good taste and especially during raining season and night huge crowd gathered to take the bite. About cleanliness same traditional safai in kitchen area and serving area which need to be take care to start journey towards mega brand. Grato Jalebi is situated near Camp Jail in front of LS stop and at the corner of road coming from Shadman and meeting with Ferozpur Road, Lahore - Pakistan. This Jalebi is a sweet dish in Pakistan, specially in Punjab. This Grato Jalebi is originally from Rawalpindi and they do have a restaurant in Islamabad as well. In Lahore they have made around 4 to 5 branches. They do have Jalebi with sugar free mode as well and also with less sugar. These modes of Jalebi is being launched in a week or so from now. Along with Jalebi they have already launched samosas, a fried snack of south Asian countries. The prices are a bit higher but taste is very good so it's worth trying. Seating isn't available by so only takeouts are offered. Amazing Jalebi, mouth watering, finger licking good. The taste is so good that you cant resist eating. Only ask for fresh and hot Jalebi, if they are not fresh then you wont enjoy it. The also have amazing Gulabjamans and you must try them too. Both these sweets are just too good and you will love them. They also have very tasty Pakoray, their pakoray are with potato fires and potato makes their Pakoray really good. I havent tried but they also serve chicken and vegitable Samosay and Rolls, they looked good too. Overall it was a very good experience and I would recommed you to visit this place.

combined_text: Karachi's Nalli Nihari Nalli Nihari A premium version of nihari made with bone marrow, found in upscale nihari houses. Ambience: 8/10 Food taste: 10/10 Service: 10/10 They have indoor and outdoor sitting place, carpetted takht with cushions and also table and chairs are available as per your comfort to jace food. Vibe is amazing as people from all over karachi come here. We had fried nihari, beef fry qeema and afghani beef boti. All 3 dishes were exceptional. At the end we also tried their creamy kashmiri chai (nuts and cream) and green tea. Recommended to everyone  Had breakfast . Ordered Halwa puri, beef Nihari, pizza cheese paratha and Nutella paratha followed by tea. Out of this, beef Nihari is best experience while Nutella paratha is also good . Worst experience ever at Nihari Inn! We went there for lunch and asked for extra Nihari gravy (and agreed to pay for it). First, the waiter refused. Then after a few minutes, he brought something and shamelessly added it to our plates  it wasnt even Nihari gravy, it was clearly Qorma gravy! When we confronted him, he blatantly lied to our faces. Even when it was obvious, he kept arguing! We had to call the manager. Instead of solving the issue, the waiter started running around like a guilty thief. Finally, the staff admitted it was Qorma gravy. If that wasnt enough, they also tried to scam us with a fake pre-payment bill! Only after serious arguments did they hand over the real bill. This place is a complete scam  fake service, fake billing, fake staff behavior. Never visiting again. Highly NOT recommended. Beware before you waste your time and money here!

combined_text: Lahore's Stuffed Paratha Stuffed Paratha Breakfast stalls in the old city serving parathas stuffed with mince, potatoes, or daal. I highly don't recommend this..!!!! During my visit, I saw something in my paratha. When I raised this issue with staff, I was told that it was not a big deal and that it wasnt poisonous or dangerous, essentially dismissing the seriousness of the situation. Instead of accepting their mistake and taking action, they acted as if it was nothing to be worried about or taken seriously. It is unacceptable to wait until a truly hazardous substance is found before taking action. Such a dismissive response not only compromises customer safety but also erodes trust in your establishment. Desi and traditional taste for paratha lovers, Allu paratha, chicken paratha, chicken cheese paratha, qeema paratha, lassi, chaiye... All is available on demand. Mostly student friendly point. Sitting is sophisticated and downstairs. MashaAllah Mozang Paratha is a gem for paratha lovers, offering an indulgent twist on traditional stuffed flatbreads. Their Cheese Paratha is a gooey, golden masterpiece, oozing with molten cheese and perfectly crisped on the griddle. The Chicken Cheese Paratha takes it up a notchsucculent minced chicken marinated in aromatic spices, layered with a generous cheese filling, makes every bite rich and satisfying. For meat enthusiasts, the Keema Cheese Paratha is a revelation: tender, spiced minced meat harmonizes with the creamy cheese, creating a flavor explosion. The raita here deserves a standing ovationits cool, creamy texture and subtle tanginess balance the bold, spicy parathas flawlessly. Fresh herbs and a hint of cumin elevate it from a side to a star. The eaterys no-frills, bustling vibe adds to its charm, with quick service and affordable prices. Portions are hearty, ensuring you leave stuffed but already craving more. Whether youre grabbing a quick bite or feasting with friends, MashaAllah Mozang Paratha delivers comfort food at its finest. Dont miss this spotits a carb-loaded dream come true! **Rating:  (5/5)** **Must-try:** Chicken Cheese Paratha + Raita combo!  #FoodieHeaven

combined_text: Hunza's Mulberry Jam Mulberry Jam Local homemade jam sold at roadside stalls and small shops. Very neat and clean rooms and bathroom.. peaceful environment...morning view of Rakaposhi is all you need....best hotel and nest location I recently had the pleasure of staying at Mulberry Hotel in Karimabad, Hunza, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of my trip to the north. Nestled in the heart of the majestic Hunza Valley, the h otel offers stunning panoramic views of the surrounding mountains  especially Rakaposhi and Ultar peaks. The balcony view was simply breathtaking  waking up to snow-capped mountains and crisp morning air was a true delight. I stayed there for a night. The rooms Was clean, well equipped with necessities such as hygiene kit, prayer mat etc. I paid PKR 8000/- for a single window room with double bed. The allied restaurant is on the opposite side of the road and the guys there are nice, welcoming but the food is average. The hotel parking is very small (2-3 cars) and access road to parking is bit steep. Second issue is the location, its on main road so you have to bear the noise of car all the night.

combined_text: Karachi's Malai Boti Malai Boti Creamy, tender chunks of chicken or beef grilled on skewers. I wanted to try out Noorani Kabab House Kata Kat for quite sometime. I had tried Noorani Kata Kat about 18-20 years ago. Today on my way back from book launch I came to Noorani Kabab House. I ordered Kata Kat Mix Plate Rs 1,480. It was Kata Kat of Mutton Kidney, Heart, Kapoora, Mutton Ribs & Brain. But the taste was more of a Brain Masala. We also ordered Nan, Paratha and Chapati. It tasted best with Nan. The total bill came to Rs 1,960. The quantity and taste of food was such that it will not attract me to come back soon. Moreover the seating arrangements for non family is on footpath and for families they have seating arrangements of hall over the kitchen area. The service is slow and one has to shout for waiters to attract attention. Payment cash only. Norani Kabab House  A True Taste of Karachis Desi Delights Located in the bustling heart of Karachi, Norani Kabab House is one of those classic desi spots that never fail to satisfy your craving for traditional Pakistani BBQ. Whether youre a student hunting for budget-friendly food, or a family looking for authentic Karachi flavors, Norani Kabab House delivers consistently good taste with no frills attached. The highlight of their menu is undoubtedly the Chicken Malai Boti  perfectly tender, creamy, and bursting with smoky flavor. Their Seekh Kababs are juicy and spiced just right, served fresh off the grill with paratha or naan. The Chicken Tikka is another crowd-pleaser, with a rich, fiery marination that BBQ lovers will appreciate. Portions are generous and prices are quite reasonable, especially considering the quality and freshness of the meat. The vibe is very local  plastic chairs, open-air seating, and the lively noise of grills sizzling in the background. Service is fast, but don't expect five-star polish  its all about the food here. A big plus is that they remain open late, making it a popular post-midnight food stop. All in all, Norani Kabab House is a must-visit if you want no-nonsense, mouthwatering desi BBQ in Karachi. Just bring your appetite  and maybe some tissue papers. Recently visited Noorani Kebab House with my family and we chose their rooftop family seating area. The ambiance was nice, especially the tables by the railing which give a good view of the road. The only slight drawback is a little BBQ smoke that reaches the tables, but nothing too overwhelming. For food, we ordered Chicken Behari Boti and Beef Behari Boti, both flavorful and well-cooked. We also tried their famous Kata Kat, customized with 2 brains, 1 heart, and 2 kidneys (all goat). It was absolutely delicious and lived up to the hype. Their raita complemented the meal really well. Personally, I found everything tasted best when paired with naan rather than parathas. Overall, it was a great experience tasty food, decent atmosphere, and a must visit for BBQ and kata kat lovers.

combined_text: Lahore's Chana Chaat Chana Chaat A tangy, spicy chickpea salad, a popular street food snack. Pathetic experience. We visited after years because we remembered how good it used to be, but this time was completely disappointing. We overpaid for terrible service and were not even served the full meal we ordered. They have removed details from their menu so they can tweak the thalis and still charge full price. When we complained, even the manager disappeared instead of addressing the issue, and the waitress knew nothing about the menu  very unprofessional behavior. Half of the items that should have been included in the thali were missing. It wasnt even a proper thali. We will not be coming back. Please dont waste your time and money here. Ive attached pictures showing what we were served versus what should have been served. Price does not justify neither the quality nor the quantity of the food. Simple order took nearly forty minutes to serve. Drinks ordered were never served despite of several reminders. The server was hiding behind the pillar to avoid me. After I finished the meal, I asked the manager about the lime drink I ordered, she said that it cannot be served because they ran out of fresh lime, that's hilarious. Never going back there again. After many years, I have had a wonderful experience of dining in at Lahore Chatkhara, Mini market, Lahore. Yummy chapli kebabs, kebob masala, paratha and naan.. customer service was exceptionally excellent. It would be unfair, not to appreciate the young waitress who served us... zabbardast client service by her.

combined_text: Quetta's Saffron Kahva Saffron Kahva Green tea infused with locally grown saffron, a luxurious and aromatic drink. If youre looking to enjoy a well-brewed cup of tea in one of Islamabads posh areas, this cafeteria is the perfect choice. The tea is wonderful, and the variety of parathas is impressive. Although the prices are slightly on the higher side, theyre well justified by the quality and ambiance. Pretty crowded place especially after the hype of their cheese paratha by foreigners. Overall they got good taste but better visit when it's less rushy otherwise prepare for long wating time. Quetta Chai offers a delightful culinary experience, particularly with their Nutella and honey parathas, which were absolutely delicious. The blend of flavors was perfect, making it a must-try for anyone visiting. However, the experience was marred by a significant issue: a large number of mosquitoes. Unfortunately, the establishment did not have any mosquito repellent measures, such as scented repellents, which are commonly used to keep these pests at bay. While the food quality is commendable and worth the visit, the lack of mosquito control significantly impacts the overall dining experience. Potential customers should be aware of this issue, especially during peak mosquito seasons. Hopefully, Quetta Chai will address this problem to ensure a more comfortable environment for their patrons.
